# Arpeggio: Minor 6th in C# (Shape: C)

## Overview
An arpeggio is a musical technique where notes in a chord are played in sequence, often used to showcase the individual tones within a chord progression. In this case, we are focusing on the minor 6th arpeggio in the key of C#.

## Notes and Intervals
The minor 6th arpeggio in C# includes the following notes: C# (root), E (3rd), G# (5th), A (6th). The intervals between these notes create a distinct sound that characterizes the minor 6th chord quality.

## Musical Flavor and Genre
The minor 6th arpeggio in C# has a melancholic and introspective quality due to the minor tonality and the inclusion of the 6th interval. This arpeggio is often used in jazz, blues, and ballad genres to evoke a sense of longing or emotional depth in a musical composition.

## Songs
Here are three songs that prominently feature the minor 6th arpeggio in C#:
1. "Autumn Leaves" - This jazz standard often includes passages that showcase the minor 6th arpeggio, adding a somber and reflective mood to the melody.
2. "All Along the Watchtower" by Jimi Hendrix - The iconic guitar solo in this song utilizes the minor 6th arpeggio in C# to create tension and drama in the performance.
3. "Hallelujah" by Leonard Cohen - The haunting chord progression in this ballad incorporates the minor 6th arpeggio, enhancing the emotional impact of the lyrics.
